radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild bibasilar atelectasis; liver demonstrates fatty infiltration with no focal lesions; normal gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands; kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically with no hydronephrosis; enlarged appendix measuring 1.2 cm with hyper-enhancing walls and significant surrounding fat stranding; fluid layering dependently adjacent to sigmoid colon; no definite organized abscess collection; free fluid in the cul-de-sac; normal bladder and terminal ureters; normal uterus and adnexa; normal rectum; no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy; no extraluminal free air; intra-abdominal vasculature is patent; bones are unremarkable.
